title: EastEnders revisits past storyline as Martin Fowler makes deadly threat to Ben Mitchell
text:

Martin Fowler viciously beat up Ben Mitchell on EastEnders on Friday, as he had enough of him blackmailing him to do dodgy jobs including car theft.

Ben had threatened Martin earlier on the week, still having the weapon used to attack his father Phil Mitchell last month.

Martin's wife Stacey Fowler attacked Phil with a wrench and left him for dead, with her and Martin fleeing Walford in the fallout - while Martin returned this week following his daughter Bex Fowler's suicide attempt.

But not even this heartache stopped Ben pressuring Martin into helping him amid his drama with the Panesar brothers, forcing Martin to steal a car for him - after he sickeningly sent a 'Fowler' wreath to his home.

(Image: BBC)

Martin had enough though and it's then he beat up Ben and issued a chilling threat, recalling a moment from their past that Martin almost killed Ben when he was a child.

Viewers may remember back in 2007, a troubled Martin wanted Phil to pay for not telling him what he knew about the disappearance of ex Sonia and their daughter Rebecca (Bex).

He kidnapped Ben and held him against his will on the bridge across the Square, before threatening to push him off and almost getting him hit by a train.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

In the latest episode, as Martin brutally attacked the now grown up Ben, he said to him: "I should have dropped you off that bridge when I had the chance.

"Face first straight into the concrete and done us all a favour. Remember that day do ya? Crying like a little baby, I even think you wet yourself.

"We're finished Ben, finished. Do you understand me? My wife is coming home with my kids."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

He then threatened to come after him if he caused him any more touble.

Later on Ben too referenced the moment they shared back in the day, before getting Martin trapped in his world yet again.

He said: "I do remember that day on the bridge obviously. Dangling a little kid with glasses and a hearing aid off a bridge... you must have really felt like the tough guy. Didn't have the guts to mess with someone your own size.

"I'm a bit bigger now and until I say so you work for me."

EastEnders airs Mondays and Fridays at 8pm, and Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7:30pm on BBC One .
description: EastEnders aired dramatic scenes on Friday night, as Ben Mitchell hinted the reason he was targeting Martin Fowler
